outputs.output_descr: In Kyrgyzstan, trade-related policy makers are better qualified to support a favourable pro-poor trade promotion environment. Local authorities, selected business associations and service providers possess better capacities to promote pro-poor trade and the selected value chains increased its productivity and export volume.

At the regional level in Central Asia, trade policy makers are better qualified to deal with regional trade issues. National export promotion agencies are cooperating regionally on regional exchange visits and coordinated marketing

In Tajikistan, trade policy documents developed and adjusted to international trade agreements. Trade promotion institutes and stakeholders strengthened in international trading and promoting sound business environments. Selected agricultural value chains are based on sustainable use of natural resources and supported information technology applied to improve business links and innovative economic activities.

In Uzbekistan, trade policy makers are better qualified on easing trade with neighbouring countries, research and extension service providers are enabled to promote innovative trade approaches and sustainable ago-processing practices in Central Asia.

project_descr: The project supports inclusive growth in Central Asia through the promotion of trade and enhancement of competitiveness, to support these countries' efforts to reduce poverty and improve peoples' lives.
project_title: Aid for Trade in Central Asia (AfT Phase III)
